error.signature: persistentvolumeclaim is in pending state: waiting for first consumer to be created before binding
error.regex: waiting for first consumer|WaitForFirstConsumer|storageclass.*not found|no persistent volumes available for this claim

verdict.summary: PVC stays Pending because of WaitForFirstConsumer binding mode, missing StorageClass, or insufficient storage capacity in the cluster.

dead_ends.action: Repeatedly delete and recreate the PVC
dead_ends.why_fails: If the StorageClass or provisioner is misconfigured, recreating won't help

dead_ends.action: Switch StorageClass binding mode to Immediate
dead_ends.why_fails: Breaks topology-aware scheduling — PV may be provisioned in wrong zone

workarounds.action: For WaitForFirstConsumer, create a pod that uses the PVC — binding happens only when a pod is scheduled
workarounds.how: Create a deployment or pod that references the PVC in its volumes section

workarounds.action: Verify the StorageClass exists and is correctly configured: kubectl get storageclass
workarounds.how: kubectl describe pvc <name> to check events and the requested StorageClass

leads_to.condition: when a pod references a PVC that never binds

preceded_by.condition: when pod scheduling reveals storage binding issues

frequently_confused_with.distinction: k8s-pvc-pending specifically covers WaitForFirstConsumer and missing StorageClass scenarios, while persistent-volume-pending covers general PV availability
